description: The Avengers reassembled to crack jokes at the Kids' Choice Awards.
title: The Original Avengers Reunite, And It Gets 'Super' Awkward
title_page: The Original Avengers Reunite, And It Gets 'Super' Awkward | HuffPost
maintext:
Not even the coronavirus can stop the Avengers from assembling.
At Nickelodeonâ€™s virtual Kidsâ€™ Choice Awards on Saturday, â€œAvengers: Endgameâ€ took the award for Favorite Movie. So in celebration, the original six Avengers remotely reunited to inspire kids and also dunk on each other.
Though 2019â€™s â€œEndgameâ€ was the end of the collective journey for the original six, the group immediately got back into its old banter, with Thor, aka Chris Hemsworth, and Captain America, aka Chris Evans, arguing about who was actually stronger.
â€œThis was my life for a decade,â€ Black Widow actor Scarlett Johansson quipped about their bickering.
Then Robert Downey Jr. joined the call, and things between the superheroes got super awkward. Downeyâ€™s Iron Man died in â€œEndgame,â€ seemingly capping off the characterâ€™s story for good (unlike Black Widow, who also died but still has a movie coming out).
â€œOh?â€ Johansson said.
â€œRobert?â€ Hulk actor Mark Ruffalo added.
â€œWe thought you were uhâ€”â€ Hawkeye actor Jeremy Renner began, apparently about to bring up Iron Manâ€™s death.
â€œWhat? Social distancing? Arenâ€™t we all?â€ Downey replied. Cue the crickets.
did you catch this Avengers: Endgame reunion during #KCA2020? ğŸ™Œ pic.twitter.com/fUFpiI6BWL â€” Nickelodeon (@Nickelodeon) May 3, 2020
Of course, it was all done in good fun, and the actors also had some positive messages for kids, telling them to stay safe and stay strong.
â€œLove you 3000,â€ Downey said.
